wiki_catalogs.name: System Overview
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the overall system architecture of sleekapp-v100. Explain its purpose as a full-stack knitwear manufacturing and supply chain management platform with AI-powered production tracking (LoopTrace Technology) and intelligent quoting. Document the implementation details including React 18 frontend, Supabase backend, Vite build system, and Tailwind CSS styling. Include both conceptual overviews for beginners and technical details for experienced developers. Use terminology consistent with the codebase such as LoopTrace, AI Quote Generator, and role-based access control. Provide practical examples demonstrating common user flows like quote generation and production tracking. Document the relationship between frontend components, Supabase Edge Functions, and PostgreSQL database. Include diagrams illustrating the 8-stage manufacturing workflow and data flow between components.

wiki_catalogs.name: LoopTrace Production Tracking
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the LoopTrace Production Tracking feature. Thoroughly explain the implementation of the 8-stage manufacturing workflow (Order Confirmation, Fabric Sourcing, Accessories Procurement, Cutting & Pattern Making, Sewing & Assembly, Quality Control, Finishing & Packaging, Shipment & Delivery). Document the real-time stage updates with visual indicators, photo evidence, and status tracking. Explain the predictive delay alert system using AI risk modeling and historical data. Detail the integration between frontend components and Supabase backend for real-time synchronization. Include concrete examples from LoopTraceTimeline.tsx and ProductionStageTimeline.tsx showing how progress is calculated and displayed. Address common issues such as delayed stage updates or synchronization conflicts and their solutions. Provide performance optimization tips for handling real-time data streams and large production datasets.

Explain the purpose of each configuration flag and its security implications. Document the migration strategy using timestamped SQL files for schema evolution and version control. Detail the initialization process with seed data scripts (seed.sql, seed_READY_TO_RUN.sql) and their role in environment setup. Include best practices for managing configuration across development, staging, and production environments. Address how configuration supports the AI-powered features and real-time functionality of the platform.

wiki_overview.content:
<blog>
# Comprehensive Project Analysis: Sleek Apparels - Loop Trace Web Application

## 1. Project Introduction

### Purpose Statement
Sleek Apparels is a comprehensive knitwear manufacturing and supply chain management platform designed to streamline apparel production with AI-powered capabilities. The application focuses on providing end-to-end visibility and intelligence throughout the manufacturing process, from initial quoting to final delivery.

### Core Goals and Objectives
- Implement AI-powered production tracking (LoopTrace Technology) for real-time visibility across manufacturing stages
- Develop an intelligent quote generation system with market research integration
- Create a role-based platform that serves buyers, suppliers, and administrators with tailored experiences
- Provide comprehensive analytics and monitoring for all stakeholders in the apparel manufacturing ecosystem

### Target Audience
- **Buyers**: Fashion brands and retailers seeking manufacturing partners
- **Suppliers**: Knitwear manufacturers and production facilities
- **Administrators**: Platform operators and management staff
- **Startups**: Emerging fashion brands requiring low MOQ manufacturing
- **International Clients**: Particularly USA and European brands looking for Bangladesh export partners

## 2. Technical Architecture

### Component Breakdown
The application follows a modern React architecture with TypeScript, leveraging Vite as the build tool and implementing a component-based design pattern. The architecture is organized into distinct layers:

```mermaid
flowchart TD
    A[Client] --> B[UI Layer]
    B --> C[State Management]
    C --> D[Data Access Layer]
    D --> E[Backend Services]
    E --> F[(Supabase Database)]
    E --> G[Supabase Edge Functions]
    E --> H[External APIs]
    
    B --> I[Analytics]
    C --> J[React Query]
    D --> K[Supabase Client]
```

### Design Patterns
The application implements several modern design patterns:

- **Component-based Architecture**: UI components are organized in a modular structure with clear separation of concerns
- **State Management**: Uses React Query for server state management and Context API for global client state
- **Lazy Loading**: Implements code splitting and lazy loading for optimal performance
- **Error Boundaries**: Implements both root and route-level error boundaries for robust error handling
- **Performance Optimization**: Includes route prefetching, image optimization, and bundle analysis

### System Relationships
The application follows a micro-frontend approach with domain-specific component organization:

```mermaid
graph TD
    App[App Component] --> Router[Router]
    App --> QueryClient[React Query Client]
    App --> Analytics[Analytics Provider]
    App --> Wishlist[Wishlist Context]
    
    Router --> Index[Homepage]
    Router --> Auth[Authentication]
    Router --> Dashboard[Dashboard Routes]
    Router --> Admin[Admin Routes]
    Router --> Production[Production Tracking]
    
    Dashboard --> Buyer[Buyer Dashboard]
    Dashboard --> Supplier[Supplier Dashboard]
    
    Admin --> AnalyticsPage[Analytics]
    Admin --> OrderManagement[Order Management]
    Admin --> ProductApproval[Product Approval]
    
    Production --> Timeline[Production Timeline]
    Production --> StageCards[Stage Management]
    Production --> Analytics[Production Analytics]
```

### Data Flow
The application implements a unidirectional data flow pattern with React Query as the central data management layer:

```mermaid
flowchart LR
    A[User Interaction] --> B[Component State]
    B --> C[React Query Mutation]
    C --> D[Supabase API]
    D --> E[PostgreSQL Database]
    E --> F[Real-time Subscription]
    F --> G[React Query Cache]
    G --> H[UI Components]
    H --> I[Visual Update]
```

## 3. Key Implementation

### Main Entry Points
- `src/main.tsx`: Application bootstrap and initialization
- `src/App.tsx`: Root component with providers and routing
- `index.html`: HTML entry point with critical script loading

Sources:
- [main.tsx](src/main.tsx)
- [App.tsx](src/App.tsx)
- [index.html](index.html)

### Core Modules
- **Routing System**: Implemented with React Router DOM, featuring lazy-loaded routes for performance optimization
- **State Management**: React Query for server state with custom hooks in `src/hooks/`
- **Authentication**: Role-based access control with Supabase authentication
- **Production Tracking**: LoopTrace system with 8-stage manufacturing workflow
- **AI Features**: Quote generation and market research capabilities

Sources:
- [App.tsx](src/App.tsx#L3-L297)
- [main.tsx](src/main.tsx)
- [hooks](src/hooks/)

### Configuration Approach
The application uses a comprehensive configuration system with environment variables and build-time optimizations:

- **Vite Configuration**: Advanced build optimizations including code splitting, compression, and asset handling
- **Environment Variables**: Supabase and Stripe configuration through environment variables
- **Performance Optimizations**: Route prefetching, image optimization, and bundle analysis

```mermaid
graph LR
    A[Development Mode] --> B[Component Tagger]
    A --> C[No Console Removal]
    A --> D[No Compression]
    
    E[Production Mode] --> F[Remove Console]
    E --> G[Gzip Compression]
    E --> H[Brotli Compression]
    E --> I[Bundle Analyzer]
    E --> J[CSS Preload]
    
    K[Vite Config] --> L[React Plugin]
    K --> M[Compression Plugin]
    K --> N[Visualizer Plugin]
    K --> O[Remove Console Plugin]
```

Sources:
- [vite.config.ts](vite.config.ts)
- [package.json](package.json)

### External Dependencies
The application leverages a modern technology stack with carefully selected dependencies:

- **Frontend Framework**: React 18 with TypeScript
- **UI Components**: shadcn/ui with Radix UI primitives
- **Styling**: Tailwind CSS with animation utilities
- **State Management**: React Query for data fetching and caching
- **Forms**: React Hook Form with Zod validation
- **Analytics**: Google Analytics 4 and Google Tag Manager
- **Database**: Supabase (PostgreSQL) with real-time capabilities

Sources:
- [package.json](package.json)

### Integration Points
The application integrates with several external services:

- **Supabase**: Backend as a Service for database, authentication, and storage
- **Stripe**: Payment processing
- **Google Analytics**: Web analytics and tracking
- **Google Tag Manager**: Marketing tag management
- **Lovable**: Development and deployment platform

```mermaid
graph LR
    A[Sleek Apparels] --> B[Supabase]
    A --> C[Stripe]
    A --> D[Google Analytics]
    A --> E[Google Tag Manager]
    A --> F[Lovable]
    
    B --> G[PostgreSQL Database]
    B --> H[Authentication]
    B --> I[Storage]
    B --> J[Edge Functions]
    
    C --> K[Payment Processing]
    
    D --> L[User Behavior Tracking]
    
    E --> M[Marketing Tags]
    
    F --> N[CI/CD Pipeline]
```

Sources:
- [vite.config.ts](vite.config.ts#L81-L83)
- [package.json](package.json)

## 4. Key Features

### Functionality Overview
The application delivers several key features focused on apparel manufacturing management:

- **LoopTrace Production Tracking**: Real-time visibility across 8 manufacturing stages
- **AI Quote Generator**: Intelligent pricing with OTP verification
- **Role-Based Access Control**: Different experiences for buyers, suppliers, and administrators
- **Marketplace Functionality**: Product catalog and supplier directory
- **Analytics Dashboard**: Business and production analytics

### Implementation Highlights
- **Production Tracking System**: 8-stage workflow with real-time updates and predictive analytics
- **AI-Powered Features**: Quote generation with market research capabilities
- **Performance Optimizations**: Code splitting, lazy loading, and bundle optimization
- **Responsive Design**: Mobile-friendly interface across all pages
- **Security Features**: OTP verification and role-based access control

```mermaid
stateDiagram-v2
    [*] --> Initial
    Initial --> Homepage: User visits site
    Homepage --> QuoteGenerator: User requests quote
    QuoteGenerator --> OTPVerification: Security check
    OTPVerification --> QuoteProcessing: Valid OTP
    QuoteProcessing --> QuoteResult: AI generates quote
    
    Homepage --> Auth: User signs in
    Auth --> Dashboard: Authentication successful
    Dashboard --> ProductionTracking: User views order
    ProductionTracking --> StageUpdate: Supplier updates stage
    StageUpdate --> Notification: Real-time alert
    Notification --> Analytics: Data recorded
    
    Dashboard --> AdminPanel: Admin user
    AdminPanel --> OrderManagement: Manage orders
    AdminPanel --> Analytics: View business metrics
```

- [README.md](README.md)
- [App.tsx](src/App.tsx)
